references.paper_title: Using large language models to simulate multiple humans
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant to the core methodology of the current paper, as it also explores the use of large language models to simulate human behavior, a key aspect of the current work.

references.paper_title: Out of one, many: Using language models to simulate human samples
references.reason: Similar to the main paper, this work utilizes language models to generate realistic representations of human behavior, providing a useful comparison and benchmark for assessing performance.
This book provides a foundational understanding of urban systems and dynamics, which is relevant to the context of the current paper on personal mobility generation.

references.paper_title: The timegeo modeling framework for urban mobility without travel surveys
references.reason: This paper proposes a modeling framework for urban mobility, which is directly comparable to the methodology used in the current paper and enables a direct performance comparison.

references.paper_title: TrajGAIL: Generating urban vehicle trajectories using generative adversarial imitation learning
references.reason: This paper presents a state-of-the-art method for generating synthetic trajectories, which serves as an important baseline and point of comparison for the proposed LLM-based approach.
